results.title: Bill Tilden's advanced tennis
results.creator_credit: New Official Films and Julian Peyser
results.brief_description: Bill Tilden narrates and demonstrates advanced techniques of tennis, including net game, foot work, smash, service and volley. Front, back, aside and overhead views permit study of his playing technique from a variety of angles.

results.title: Bill Gates: information at your fingertips 2004
results.brief_description: Bill Gates, Chairman and CEO of Microsoft Corporation presents a lecture, delivered in 1994 that predicts the technology and software that will be commonplace in the year 2004. To illustrate his many astoundingly accurate theories, Gates presents a fictional film that anticipates the extensive use of the Internet at home and work, mini-computers facilitating financial transactions checking and transferring funds, teleconferencing in cars enhancing communication for mobile workers, electronic maps providing expedient routes for drivers and the everyday use of email. School students will use the Internet for assignments, downloading images and text, presenting sophisticated graphics in class. In the medical arena, ambulance workers will scan injuries, ascertaining advice from doctors and nurses who download patient’s medical history and personal details. Gates forecasts that even the most minor business will have a website, and that at home entertainment will be re-shaped by interactive television and on-line activities such as gambling. He also envisages problematic issues such as privacy, copywriting information and images on the net, and concerns surrounding the sharing of information. Gates recognises the need for high-speed networks and integrated hardware that familiarises people and businesses with an array of hi-tech activities. An illuminating lecture.

results.title: Bill Cosby on prejudice
results.brief_description: In a makeup that is a cross between the mask of an African storyteller and a harlequin, comic Bill Cosby’s bigot destroys the human race. Under his spoofing lies a serious comment that stimulates honest discussion of the problems of racial prejudice. Photographer: Walter Eby; music: Willie Ruff.

results.title: Bilingual kids
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and James Mann
results.brief_description: This program is designed to introduce teachers, parents and communities to the concept of bilingual education. It looks at processes involved in the implementation of the Greek:English Bilingual Pilot Project in the Richmond-Collingwood area. A number of evaluation findings are also discussed

results.title: Biko: Breaking the silence
results.brief_description: A political documentary shot in Zimbabwe and South Africa, this commemorates the 10th anniversary of Steve Biko’s death. It provides an insight into the complexities of the politics of the last decade, pivoting on the powerfully influential character of Biko. The film defines the aims of the Black Consciousness Movement of which Biko was an active and important leader, and explores its relevance from inception in the late 60s to the present day. It includes interviews with friends and medical and professional colleagues.

results.title: Bike style
results.brief_description: Two couples discover the joys of a summer holiday travelling by bicycles through Yugoslavia. The challenge of the trip, the opportunity of meeting people and the personal satisfaction are highlighted.

results.title: Bike people
results.creator_credit: Charles Cahill and Associates and Phil Kassel
results.brief_description: More and more people are riding bikes today, and here the basic safety precautions, optional equipment and protection against theft are discussed. The film explains bike vehicle code rules which are designed to make riding safe and fun, and points out that equipment can add to safe riding.
